intro: Prunus nana var. alba, commonly known as the white dwarf cherry, is a compact shrub native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It produces small, white flowers that bloom in early spring, adding a delicate floral display to its dense, low-growing form. The plant has dark green, oval-shaped leaves that turn red in the fall, enhancing its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is hardy in cold climates. Due to its size and beauty, it is often cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal and ecological benefits.
